org.jamwiki.parser

Class ParserInput

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jamwiki.parser.ParserInput

  • public class ParserInput
extends Object
    This class is a utility class used to hold configuration settings for the parser.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ParserInput(ParserInput parserInput)
      Copy constructor.
      ParserInput(String virtualWiki, String topicName)

        public ParserInput(String virtualWiki,

    • Method Detail

      • getAllowSectionEdit

        public boolean getAllowSectionEdit()
        This method will return true if edit links are allowed next to each section heading. During preview and in some other instances that feature needs to be disabled.
        Returns:
        Returns true if edit links are allowed next to each section heading.

      • setAllowSectionEdit

        public void setAllowSectionEdit(boolean allowSectionEdit)
        Set method used to indicate whether or not to allow edit links next to each section heading. During preview and in some other instances that feature needs to be disabled.
        Parameters:
        allowSectionEdit - Set to true if edits links are allowed next to each section heading, false otherwise.

      • getAllowTableOfContents

        public boolean getAllowTableOfContents()
        This method will return true if a table of contents can be included in the parsed topic content. System topics such as the left menu and footer should not display a TOC.
        Returns:
        Returns true if a table of contents can be included in the parsed topic content.

      • setAllowTableOfContents

        public void setAllowTableOfContents(boolean allowTableOfContents)
        Set method to indicate whether or not a table of contents can be included in the parsed topic content. System topics such as the left menu and footer should not display a TOC.
        Parameters:
        allowTableOfContents - Set to true if a table of contents can be included in the parsed topic content.

      • getContext

        public String getContext()
        Get the servlet context associated with the current parser input instance. Servlet context is used when building links.
        Returns:
        The servlet context associated with the current parser input instance.

      • setContext

        public void setContext(String context)
        Set the servlet context associated with the current parser input instance. Servlet context is used when building links.
        Parameters:
        context - The servlet context associated with the current parser input instance.

      • getDepth

        public int getDepth()
        Since it is possible to call a new parser instance from within another parser instance, depth provides a way to determine how many times the parser has nested, thus providing a way of avoiding infinite loops.
        Returns:
        The current nesting level of the parser instance.

      • decrementDepth

        public void decrementDepth()
        This method decreases the current parser instance depth and should only be called when a parser instance exits. Depth is useful as a way of avoiding infinite loops in the parser.

      • incrementDepth

        public void incrementDepth()
                    throws ExcessiveNestingException
        This method increases the current parser instance depth and should only be called when a instantiating a new parser instance. Depth is useful as a way of avoiding infinite loops in the parser.
        Throws:
        ExcessiveNestingException - Thrown if incrementing the depth would cause the depth to exceed the maximum configured depth. Useful for infinite loop detection.

      • getInfiniteLoopCount

        public int getInfiniteLoopCount()
        The infinite loop count records how many times the parser has found what it believes to be an infinite loop while parsing a topic. Each time such a loop is encountered the parser will abort and move on to the next tag, so this counter provides a way of essentially saying "enough is enough" if too many such loops are encountered.

      • getLocale

        public Locale getLocale()
        Get the locale associated with the current parser input instance. Locale is used primarily when building links or displaying messages.
        Returns:
        The locale associated with the current parser input instance.

      • setLocale

        public void setLocale(Locale locale)
        Set the locale associated with the current parser input instance. Locale is used primarily when building links or displaying messages.
        Parameters:
        locale - The locale associated with the current parser input instance.

      • getTableOfContents

        public TableOfContents getTableOfContents()
        Get the table of contents object associated with the current parser input instance. The table of contents is used for building an internal set of links to headings in the current document.
        Returns:
        The table of contents object associated with the current parser input instance.

      • getTempParam

        public Object getTempParam(String key)
        If the map of arbitrary temporary parameters contains the specified key then return its value, otherwise return null.
        Returns:
        The value of the specified key in the temporary parameters map, or null if no such value exists.

      • addTempParam

        public void addTempParam(String key,
                         Object value)
        Add an item to the map of arbitrary temporary parameters. If an item with the same key is already in the map then it will be overwritten.
        Parameters:
        key - The key to use for the map entry.
        value - The value to store in the map for the specified key.

      • removeTempParam

        public void removeTempParam(String key)
        Remove an item to the map of arbitrary temporary parameters. If no item with the specified key is in the map then this function has no effect.
        Parameters:
        key - The key for the map entry being removed.

      • getTemplateDepth

        public int getTemplateDepth()
        Get the depth level when template code is being parsed.
        Returns:
        The current number of template inclusions.

      • decrementTemplateDepth

        public void decrementTemplateDepth()
        This method decreases the current template inclusion depth and should only be called when a template finishes processing.

      • incrementTemplateDepth

        public void incrementTemplateDepth()
        This method decreases the current template inclusion depth and should only be called when a template begins processing.

      • getTopicName

        public String getTopicName()
        Get the topic name for the topic being parsed by this parser input instance.
        Returns:
        The topic name for the topic being parsed by this parser input instance.

      • getUserDisplay

        public String getUserDisplay()
        Get the user display name associated with the current parser input instance. This value is typically the user IP address and is used primarily when parsing signatures.
        Returns:
        The user display, typically the user IP address, associated with the current parser input instance.

      • setUserDisplay

        public void setUserDisplay(String userDisplay)
        Set the user display name associated with the current parser input instance. This value is typically the user IP address and is used primarily when parsing signatures.
        Parameters:
        userDisplay - The user display, typically the user IP address, associated with the current parser input instance.

      • getVirtualWiki

        public String getVirtualWiki()
        Get the virtual wiki name associated with the current parser input instance. The virtual wiki name is used primarily when parsing links.
        Returns:
        The virtual wiki name associated with the current parser input instance.

      • getWikiUser

        public WikiUser getWikiUser()
        Get the wiki user object associated with the current parser input instance. The wiki user object is used primarily when parsing signatures.
        Returns:
        The wiki user object associated with the current parser input instance.

      • setWikiUser

        public void setWikiUser(WikiUser user)
        Set the wiki user object associated with the current parser input instance. The wiki user object is used primarily when parsing signatures.
        Parameters:
        user - The wiki user object associated with the current parser input instance.
